reviewText: I purchased this because of the price of the DVD, given you get 4 workouts. I really wanted Pump, Jump 'n Jab, but didn't want to pay the same price for only 1 video, so I got this set instead! Kelsie is fantastic and it is nice because the entire workout is only 40 minutes, including the warm up and cool down. It is a total body cardio-kickboxing workout that will leave you sore the next day! I used it with 1 lb weighted hand gloves and it was a great workout. I do pump jump jab in the evenings to supplement my am routine. When I have done the others, I will add to this review!
summary: Pump, Jump 'n Jab is awesome on this set!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Prior to purchasing this DVD, I actually already owned one of the workouts it includes, Firm Pump, Jump, & Jab.  Since I knew I liked this workout, I figured that upgrading to the Firm's Ultimate Fat-Burning Collection DVD, which contains FOUR workouts, would be a good bargain.  Happily, I was right!  I have provided brief descriptions of each of the four workouts below, but I have also linked to the individual workout DVDs, where you can read my longer reviews of each workout if you are interested.The Firm: Pump, Jump 'N JabThis 42-minute workout is led by Kelsie Daniels, one of my favorite Firm instructors.  The only equipment you need for the workout is a set of dumbbells; Kelsie cues you to use "medium to heavy" weights, but I found that sticking with 5-pound dumbbells throughout was challenging yet allowed me to focus mainly on the cardio benefits of the moves.  Kelsie leads this fat-burning routine by combining kickboxing and sculpting intervals.  I do wish there had been more kickboxing, as the kickboxing segments are a lot of fun (there are 2 segments, each approximately 5 minutes).  The workout concludes on the floor for push-ups, abs work, and a 5-minute cool-down.The FIRM: Cardio OverdriveThis is a 46-minute AWT (aerobic weight training) workout led by Allison Davis.  Each segment of the workout last approximately 5 minutes:  Allison alternates weights work with pure cardio sequences, but even the weights exercises are designed to keep your heart rate up.  I found most of the choreography to be fun, but sometimes the Firm's arm movements feel a bit "fussy" to me, and some of the moves in this workout felt overly rushed.  However, my heart rate stayed within my working zone the entire time, yet I never felt worn out or like I was gasping for breath.  Overall, I felt that this was a decent workout that I would rate as low intermediate.The Firm: Burn and ShapeThis workout is led by Emily Welsh, another Firm instructor who I like a lot.  It is a cardio sculpting routine of about 41 minutes in length, and here, Emily uses 3 sets of dumbbells, light, medium, and heavy (I used 3s, 5s, and 10s).  I found the warm-up to be on the overly long side at 7 minutes and to be a bit difficult to follow.  Otherwise, I liked how Emily added some unique twists on more traditional moves--eg, a plie which adds a twisting delt raise, and then she does a traditional rear delt raise with a bit of a twist.  The cardio is mostly low impact (Emily does add some plyo moves), and overall, I found the workout to be fun.The Firm - Cardio Sculpt FusionThis workout was my favorite new discovery on this DVD!  It is also led by Emily, and it was previously released under the title "Total Body Lite" as well.  It is a 46-minute "muscle recovery" workout; Emily emphasizes that you don't want to fatigue your muscles. Given this, she uses light weights throughout--either a single 5# or 2 lighter weights (I used 3#).  However, this is still a true AWT (aerobic weight training) workout in that you are constantly moving while using the weights, keeping your heart rate up the entire time.  Emily alternates standing weights and cardio segments, and she concludes with some brief floor work (she does side planks, moving plank, flying bug, and ab circles rather than traditional crunches) as well as a nice 5.5-minute stretch.  Overall, I really enjoyed this workout, and I think those who enjoy Ellen Barrett-style workouts are apt to enjoy this one as well.So, as you can see, this DVD was clearly an excellent choice for me!  Given the price, I think it would be a great deal for most people--especially experienced beginner to intermediate exercisers--and I would definitely recommend it.  I do have one caution, however:  on the back of the DVD case, it talks about the availability of "Express" options for the different workouts.  Although these options WERE included when the workouts were sold separately (i.e., as individual DVDs), they are NOT included on this compilation DVD.  The Main Menu of this DVD simply lists each of the four workouts with NO other options.  I still think this DVD is worthwhile, but buyers should purchase it with clear expectations.
summary: Great bargain--4 excellent Firm workouts on one DVD!

reviewText: Too many complex step moves for me to find enjoyable of effective. I don't have the time to do these routine 20 times each to learn the moves. I didn't get past the first 10 minutes of one routine, let alone all three. Give me something I can follow. Love lots of firm workouts, just not these.

reviewText: Buy this strictly for Kelsie's workout. Haven't done all yet, just Allion's and Kelsie's. Allison's other DVD is MUCH better (bootcamp maximum calorie burn)...this one of hers is pretty lame. I am hoping the other ones are good too. Kelsie's session is very very good....love the kickboxing moves!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I read other customers' reviews before purchasing this DVD.  I have many Firm videos and wanted to add variety to my collection.  One of the main negatives I saw was the lack of express versions of the workouts as advertised.  I understand that concern, but for me, it was a plus.  I was specifically looking for full versions and not express versions.  I already had Burn and Shape, which is hard to follow the first time or two you do it. Emily Welsh, who is normally really good at cueing, introduces new moves without enough notice and it's hard to keep up initially. However, it is definitely a good workout once you've done it enough times to remember what moves come next.  Allison Davis is quickly becoming my favorite Firm instructor and I really enjoyed Cardio Overdrive.  I definitely worked up a sweat!  Pump Jump 'n Jab - whew!  Now THAT is a workout!The reason I gave this product 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the last workout.  It's called Cardio Sculpt Fusion on the packaging, but Emily Welsh calls it Total Body Lite in the video.  To me, it doesn't belong on a DVD called the "Ultimate Fat-Burning Collection."  I've read other reviews of that workout and reviewers say it's good for an active rest day.  Maybe, but I doubt I'll do that one very often.  Still, I couldn't beat the price - even if I only ever do 3 of the 4 workouts.  Those three are worth the price.Three months after my initial review, I have decided to add a star.  In all honesty, I have still never done the Cardio Sculpt Fusion/Total Body Lite workout on this disc.  I still intend to try it sometime on a slow day when I'm feeling a little sluggish.  With that said, I am adding a star because I absolutely LOVE Pump, Jump & Jab.  It has become one of my favorites when I want a great all over workout!  I do still like Cardio Overdrive and Burn & Shape too, but Pump, Jump & Jab has become my go-to workout on this disc!
summary: Can't beat getting 4 workouts for way less than the price of 1!

reviewText: This is a good workout selection because it gives you many options to chose from. That being said, I think if you do any one of these a lot, you will get bored after awhile.

reviewText: I am new to the firm and bought several dvds at once.  Was surprised to realize that this is repackaged items.  Especially the last workout which turned out to be an "easy" day workout.  Did not give me what I expected.
summary: Appears to be a repackage of other dvds

reviewText: I was excited about this product because there are four 45 minute workouts included. However, they do not provide any workouts or sweating, just frustration that you can't follow their pointless, over-complicated moves.I've wasted too much money on The Firm. Save your money and go with Jillian or Jackie.
